result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kelsey Reuail Schlais is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kelsey Reuail Schlais was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelsey Reuail Schlais

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Case Letter

AND BAIL/BOND HEARING 01:17 PM Defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais in custody.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant has been unable to post cash bail. Defendant is lifelong resident. Requests a high dollar signature bond. State reviews seven failures to appear including a probation revocation. State concerned about defendant following court orders. Defendant was on a probation hold up until March 5, 2022. Attorney Hoffman has nothing further. Court reviews charges and the repeaters on each of the offenses. Court has concern regarding failures to appear. Court denies modification for bail. Defendant would now like to resolve case today. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to Count 2. Count 1 to be dismissed. For Count 2, 12 months jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 30 days conditional jail, pay restitution in amount of $50, fine of $10 plus court costs. 30 days conditional jail consecutive to any other sentence. Imposed and stayed time if revoked consecutive to any other sentence. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 2, 12 months jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 30 days conditional jail with credit of 10 days, pay restitution in amount of $50, fine of $10 plus court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and no contact with victim or their address. 30 days conditional jail consecutive to any other sentence. Imposed and stayed time if revoked consecutive to any other sentence. 60 days to pay. Count 1 is dismissed.

11:18 AM Defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais in custody.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes offer has been made but not quite resolved and requests another status conference. Court to set next hearing at tomorrow's bail hearing.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key; within 24 hours of release from jail, defendant must update his address

01:38 PM Defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman. Defendant Kelsey Reuail Schlais in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, and pleads not guilty to misdemeanors counts. Court accepts plea on both counts and will set the matter for Status Conference with Judge Glonek. State requests on bail: $1000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or their residence and do not return to that address. Defendant has 7 F.T.A.'s. Defendant is on extended supervision hold for 2016 felony case with a 2017 convicition with why the repeater charge. 
Atty Hoffman questions defendant regarding bail. Defendant is a lifelong resident of this area. Defendant was not employed at the time of his arrest. Defendant has no money to post towards bail.  
Court Ordres $1000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or their residence; defendant must update address within 24 hours of release
Defendant does quailfy. Court reminds defendant of text message reminder slip.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
